detaileddescription.para: Used for setup the Wakeup Unit befor sleep.

Used to set the pointer to the "MC_PCU" (Power Control Unit) peripheral on standby.
value 0x25ffuL
Used to set LIN2 and LIN3 transceivers to sleep mode.

Used to set DO_TXD_LIN2 and DO_TXD_LIN3 to high impedance.
value 0x00080000uL
HAL WakeupSrc Type.

Used to store a RAM copy of the WISR register.
Protection not required as long as it is written only from SystemControl. See Shared Variables Analysis
HAL ConfigSet Type

Active HAL config set depending on the HW version.
range HAL_ConfigSet_Type const * values The address of HAL_config_set for Port Configuration Set B1 and Adc Configuration Set B1 unit N/A resolution N/A context task context DWA_LIN_WAKEUP_MASK, Board_GPIO_MSCR_index, DWA_LIN_WAKEUP_MASK, HAL_WakeupBits_AllValidBits protection none storage class init ram
Get pointer to the "SIUL1" (System Integration Unit Lite2) peripheral.
Get pointer to the "SIUL2" (System Integration Unit Lite2) peripheral.

The Buddy Device-System Integration Unit Lite1 (BD_SIUL2) provides control over the electrical pads of the buddy device (BD), as well as implementing various SoC functions that are not included in other modules.
N/A
N/A
void
&SIUL2
Globals
N/A
reentrant No context task context HAL_VARIANT - HAL_Transceivers_SetHighImpedance_LIN_2_3 function and Prepare_Ports_ForSleepMode function thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous N/A
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check the address of SIUL2. TEST_Board_Peripheral_SIUL2 Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function needed by HAL_Transceivers_SetHighImpedance_LIN_2_3 and Prepare_Ports_ForSleepMode (SWR_ICAS1_GW_18926, SWR_ICAS1_GW_19691). The Buddy Device-System Integration Unit Lite1 (BD_SIUL2) provides control over the electrical pads of the buddy device (BD), as well as implementing various SoC functions that are not included in other modules.
Get pointer to the "WKPU" Wakeup unit peripheral.

This function is used to return the address of WKPU_0 (0xf7f98000) or WKPU_1 (0xfbf98000).

&WKPU_0 &WKPU_1

Design Decision - Justification. Helper function needed by all context functions.
Get pointer to the "MC_PCU" (Power Control Unit) peripheral.

The MC_PCU provides a status register and a submodule, the PMC_dig (Power Management Control Digital Interface, provides an interface to configure and control internal voltages.

void

Enable filering for wakeups or interrupts.

Write in Wakeup/Interrupt Filter Enable Register (WIFER).
This register is used to enable an analog filter on the corresponding interrupt pads to filter out glitches on the inputs. The number of wakeups/interrupts supporting this feature is SoC dependent and can be configured to be between 1 and 32.
N/A
N/A
unit
- WKP unit range uint8 resolution N/A unit N/A
bit_mask
- wakeup bit mask range HAL_WakeupBitMask_Type resolution N/A unit N/A
void

reentrant No context task context HAL_VARIANT - HAL_WakeupUnit_Init thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous Wakeup/Interrupt Filter Enable Register (WIFER) is used to enable (write) filering for wakeups or interrupts.
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if the filering for wakeups or interrupts is enabled. TEST_Board_WakeupBits_EnablePadsAnalogFilter Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function needed by HAL_WakeupUnit_Init
Enable pull up for Wakeups/Interrupts.

Write in Wakeup/Interrupt Pullup Enable Register (WIPUER).
This register is used to enable a pullup on the corresponding interrupt pads to pull an unconnected wakeup/interrupt input to a value of '1'.
N/A
N/A

- WKP unit range uint8 resolution N/A unit N/A

Init wakeup unit

This function is used to enable wakeup bits, to set enabled interrupts for wakeup bits, to enable filering for wakeup or interrupts, to enable pull up for wakeups or interrupts, to set enabled wakeups on rising edge and to set enabled wakeups on falling edge.
N/A
N/A
unit
- WKP unit range uint8 resolution N/A unit N/A
void

Call Sequence
Test Method

Design Decision - Justification. Helper function needed by HAL_InitWakeupUnit

Sets the pointer HAL_active_config_set to the valid HAL_config_set.

Sets the pointer HAL_active_config_set to the valid HAL_config_set depending on the Hardware variant. The used components and interfaces are defined in hal_cfg.xml.
N/A
N/A
hwVersion
- Board version range HardwareVersionType resolution N/A unit N/A
void
Globals
HAL_active_config_set [out]
reentrant No context task context PostBuildHendler - PostBuildHandler_McalInit_LIN4_DWA_mode and PostBuildHandler_McalInit thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous Sets the pointer HAL_active_config_set to the valid HAL_config_set depending on the Hardware variant. For example if hwVersion is VW_MEB19_ICAS1_B1: HAL_active_config_set=&HAL_config_set[_PortConfigSet_B1_AdcConfigSet_B1];
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if the pointer HAL_active_config_set is set correctly. TEST_HAL_SetActiveConfigSet Traceability
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_GW_9711 Design Decision - Justification. The HAL configuration is dependent on the HW version and needs to be updated at startup.
Check if a new wakeup was detected by the wakeup unit and clear the bit flag.

This function checks if wakeup unit is valid, read the wakeup bits, and then check if a new wakeup was detected by the wakeup unit and clear the bit flag.
N/A
N/A
wakeup_bit
- pointer to a wakeup reason from HAL_active_config_set range HAL_WakeupReason_Type resolution N/A unit N/A
- TRUE if wakeup was detected
FALSE if no wakeup was detected
Globals
WAKEUP_UNIT_INVALID [in] WakeupSrc [in/out]
reentrant No context task context WakeupSleep - doBusRxWakeupHandling thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous WAKEUP_UNIT_INVALID is used to check if the wakeup unit is valid or not. WakeupSrc is used to check and clear wakeup bit.
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if the function clear the bit flag when a new wakeup was detected by the wakeup unit. TEST_HAL_WakeupReason_CheckNewEventAndClear Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function clear the wakeup event from the HW wakeup unit and WakeupSrc copy.

Enable the wakeup reasons from low power (including RTC_API) for low power DWA.

This function is used to enable the wakeup reasons from low power (including RTC_API) for low power DWA by clearing last 2 bits of **WKPU[0].WISR, enabling Rising-Edge Event and enabling Wakeup Bits.
N/A
N/A
void
void
Globals
INTERNAL_RTC_WKP_MASK [in]
reentrant No context task context LowPower_HAL - Hal_LpTimer_EnableWakeup thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous RTC_INT used the last 2 bits from the WKPU.
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if the wakeup reasons are enabled. TEST_Hal_Lpw_EnableWakeupSources Traceability
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_GW_18931
SWR_ICAS1_GW_19869
Store the wakeup bits and then clear the wakeup source register.

Store the wakeup bits in WakeupSrc and Msg_KN_Gateway_diag then clear the wakeup source register. Bits are cleared by writing 1.
N/A
N/A
void
void
Globals
WakeupSrc [out]
reentrant No context task context bstartrtsw - main_Core2 thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous WakeupSrc is used to store (write) the wakeup bits and to clear the wakeup source register.
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if the wakeup bits are stored correctly and if the clear of the wakeup source register has been done. TEST_GetWakeupSrc Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. The wakeup information is saved in a RAM image to void loosing the information during initialization and in buffer Msg_KN_Gateway_diag fo diagnosis.

This function is used to Clear WakeupSrc.

void

reentrant No context task context SystemControl - OS_TASK_SystemControlTask thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous This function set WakeupSrc wakeup bits to 0.
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if WakeupSrc is cleared (set to 0). TEST_ClearWakeupSrc Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Clear the wakeup information that is saved in a RAM image to void loosing the information.
Check whether there should be a transition from low power mode to high power

This function check if there is a transition from low power mode to high power by checking if: DWA LIN is armed, checking active wakeups and checking if LIN4 is running in sleep. If DWA LIN is unarmed, the functions checks only active wakeups.
N/A
N/A
void
- TRUE if a high power mode wakeup is active
FALSE otherwise
Globals
WakeupSrc [in] INTERNAL_RTC_WKP_MASK [in]
reentrant No context task context SystemControl - OS_TASK_SystemControlTask DWA_LowPower - Lpw_State_Poll LowPower_Main - Lpw_LowPowerLoop thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous WakeupSrc - needed to check wakeup bits. INTERNAL_RTC_WKP_MASK - RTC_INT used the last 2 bits from the WKPU. It is used for checking the active wakeups.
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if the task is blocked for the defined delay time. TEST_HalIsLowPowerToHighPowerWakeup Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if the functions returns correctly if a high power mode wakeup is active or not. Needed by OS_TASK_SystemControlTask to implement {SWR_ICAS1_GW_16106, SWR_ICAS1_GW_16107}
Check whether only a wakeup from the internal RTC is active.

This function is used to check whether only a wakeup from the internal RTC is active and to return the status (if it is active or not).
N/A
N/A
void
TRUE if a RTC wakeup is active FALSE otherwise
Globals
WakeupSrc [in] INTERNAL_RTC_WKP_MASK [in]
reentrant No context task context LowPower_Main - Lpw_SplitOnLowPower thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous WakeupSrc is used to check the wakeup bits. INTERNAL_RTC_WKP_MASK - RTC_INT used the last 2 bits from the WKPU. In this function is used to check whether only a wakeup from the internal RTC is active.
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check the value of retVal according to each case. TEST_HalIsLowPowerWakeup Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if the system should stay in low power (RTC_DWA mode). Needed by Lpw_SplitOnLowPower to implement {SWR_ICAS1_GW_11145}.

Configure ports for sleep.

This function is used to configure ports for sleep. It set the standby-pin to standby, set digital value for DO_ENABLE_KL30_DIAGNOSE to low, clear the wakeup bits, check if NvM data stored in Standby RAM is valid mark core1, core0 and HSM as inactive for the next Mcu mode transition, set LIN2 and LIN3 transceivers to sleep mode, set CAN or LIN transceiver to sleep mode, disable all pad keepers and set digital value for GW2WD_LOWPOWER - GPIO_7 to low.
To be called after #HAL_SetActiveConfigSe
The ECU needs to go to sleep
void
void
Globals
DWA_LIN_MAX_SHUTDOWN_TIME_MS [in] _Diag, _ComChannelLinFirst, _ComChannelLinLast [in] PORT_PIN_LEVEL_LOW [in] SCR0 [out]
reentrant No context task context No thread safe No - Integration must insure that that function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No synchronous DWA_LIN_MAX_SHUTDOWN_TIME_MS - used to set a block time. _Diag, _ComChannelLinFirst, _ComChannelLinLast - used to set ComChannel to normal mode and sleep mode. PORT_PIN_LEVEL_LOW - used to set digital value for DO_ENABLE_KL30_DIAGNOSE - GPIO_2 and GW2WD_LOWPOWER - GPIO_7 on low
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: Test case shall be created to check if the ports are configured for sleep. TEST_HAL_Prepare_Ports_ForSleepMode Traceability
Satisfies requirement
